channel.title: Scene on Santosh
channel.description: Recent content in Scene on Santosh

item.title: Customer churn prediction
item.description: Problem Statement A Bank wants to take care of customer retention for its product: savings accounts. The bank wants you to identify customers likely to churn balances below the minimum balance. I have the customers information such as age, gender, demographics along with their transactions with the bank. My task as a data scientist would be to predict the propensity to churn for each customer. Link to Github Repository

item.title: ML Job Market Segmentation in India
item.description: Aim: 1.To enable the company to recognize best fit candidate for ml engineer/data analyst with respect to his /her skills. 2.To analyse the ml job market in India and outline the most optimal segment to apply for ml jobs. Dataset EDA Followed different data cleaning & pre-processing techniques Model & Training Used K-means clustering Link to Github Repository

item.title: Plant Seedling Image Classification
item.description: Problem statement To identify species of a given image (which class it belongs to, out of 12 weed species). To develop a CNN model, trained on “V-2 plant seedlings dataset”. Dataset “V-2 plant seedlings dataset” having 5539 images of crop and weeds. Weeds belongs to 12 different category. Link to Github Repository

item.title: Fashion Image Classifier using Keras
item.description: Problem Statement It is an example of multi class classification problem . Here, our model has to classify a given fashion image into which class it belongs to out of 10 classes. It is a simple neural network model , trained on Fashion MNIST dataset. It has been implemented using Keras Sequential API. Dataset It is a dataset of 70,000 grayscale images of 28*28 pixels each, with 10 classes. It is very similar to MNIST dataset but here each class is more diverse and thus problem is comparatively more challenging.
